conclusion: Determine two separate times and distances for cargo movement on conveyor.
Time for cargo to reach conveyor speed and time to travel remaining distance.
Initial acceleration of cargo due to frictional force is calculated.
Acceleration of cargo is 2 m/s^2 using Newton's second law.
Distance traveled by cargo until it reaches conveyor speed is 1 m.
Time to reach conveyor speed is 1 second.
Remaining distance to travel after reaching conveyor speed is 5 m.
Time to travel remaining distance is 2.5 seconds.
Total time to travel from left to right end of conveyor is 3.5 seconds.
Final answer: acceleration is 2 m/s^2 and total travel time is 3.5 seconds.
